[30;1m1421 | [0m[35m        The label property can be used distinguish between multiple secrets[0m
[30;1m1422 | [0m[35m        in event handlers like :class:`ops.SecretChangedEvent <ops.charm.SecretChangedEvent>`.[0m
[30;1m1423 | [0m[35m        For example, if a charm is observing two secrets, it might call[0m
[30;1m1424 | [0m[35m        ``model.get_secret(id=secret_id, label='db-password')`` and[0m
[30;1m1425 | [0m[35m        ``model.get_secret(id=secret_id, label='tls-cert')`` in the relevant[0m
[30;1m1426 | [0m[35m        relation-changed event handlers, and then switch on ``event.secret.label``[0m
[30;1m1427 | [0m[35m        in secret-changed::[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m106[0m[34m of [0m[33m1467[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m1413 | [0m[35m        """Label used to reference this secret locally.[0m
[30;1m1414 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1415 | [0m[35m        This label is effectively a name for the secret that's local to the[0m
[30;1m1416 | [0m[35m        charm, for example "db-password" or "tls-cert". The secret owner sets[0m
[30;1m1417 | [0m[35m        a label with :meth:`Application.add_secret` or :meth:`Unit.add_secret`,[0m
[30;1m1418 | [0m[35m        and the secret observer sets a label with a call to[0m
[30;1m1419 | [0m[35m        :meth:`Model.get_secret`.[0m

[30;1m1421 | [0m[35m        The label property can be used distinguish between multiple secrets[0m
[30;1m1422 | [0m[35m        in event handlers like :class:`ops.SecretChangedEvent <ops.charm.SecretChangedEvent>`.[0m
[30;1m1423 | [0m[35m        For example, if a charm is observing two secrets, it might call[0m
[30;1m1424 | [0m[35m        ``model.get_secret(id=secret_id, label='db-password')`` and[0m

[30;1m1414 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1415 | [0m[35m        This label is effectively a name for the secret that's local to the[0m
[30;1m1416 | [0m[35m        charm, for example "db-password" or "tls-cert". The secret owner sets[0m
[30;1m1417 | [0m[35m        a label with :meth:`Application.add_secret` or :meth:`Unit.add_secret`,[0m
[30;1m1418 | [0m[35m        and the secret observer sets a label with a call to[0m

[30;1m197 | [0m[35m    Juju 2.7.0 and later provide the JUJU_DISPATCH_PATH environment variable.[0m
[30;1m198 | [0m[35m    Earlier versions called individual hook scripts, and that are supported via[0m
[30;1m199 | [0m[35m    two separate mechanisms:[0m
[30;1m200 | [0m[35m    - Charmcraft 0.1.2 and produce `dispatch` shell script that fills this[0m
[30;1m201 | [0m[35m      environment variable if it's missing[0m
[30;1m202 | [0m[35m    - Ops 0.8.0 and later likewise take use ``sys.argv[0]`` if the environment[0m
[30;1m203 | [0m[35m      variable is missing[0m

[30;1m318 | [0m[35m            # deferred handler with reemit(), but still expect the next emit()[0m
[30;1m319 | [0m[35m            # to result in a call, so we can't safely skip duplicate events.[0m
[30;1m320 | [0m[35m            # When behaviour matching production is required, Scenario tests[0m
[30;1m321 | [0m[35m            # should be used instead.[0m

[30;1m280 | [0m[35m    def get_secret(self, *, id: Optional[str] = None, label: Optional[str] = None) -> 'Secret':[0m
[30;1m281 | [0m[35m        """Get the :class:`Secret` with the given ID or label.[0m
[30;1m282 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m283 | [0m[35m        The caller must provide at least one of `id` (the secret's locator ID)[0m

[30;1m503 | [0m[35m                notify the charm by sending a SecretExpired event. None (the[0m
[30;1m504 | [0m[35m                default) means the secret will never expire.[0m

[30;1m416 | [0m[35m`git log` is used to see every change since a previous release. Obviously, no[0m
[30;1m417 | [0m[35mspecial work needs to be done so that this is available. A link to the GitHub[0m
[30;1m418 | [0m[35mview of the log will be included at the end of the GitHub release notes when[0m

[30;1m420 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m421 | [0m[35m```[0m

[30;1m344 | [0m[35mTo make a release of the `ops` and/or `ops-scenario` packages, do the following:[0m
[30;1m345 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m346 | [0m[35m1. Check if there's a `chore: update charm pins` auto-generated PR in the queue.[0m
[30;1m347 | [0m[35m   If it looks good, merge it and check that tests still pass. If needed, you[0m
[30;1m348 | [0m[35m   can re-trigger the `Update Charm Pins` workflow manually to ensure latest[0m
[30;1m349 | [0m[35m   charms and ops get tested.[0m

[30;1m257 | [0m[35m## How to document version dependencies[0m
[30;1m258 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m259 | [0m[35mWe don't publish separate documentation for separate versions of ops.[0m
[30;1m260 | [0m[35mThe published docs at [ops.readthedocs.io](https://ops.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html)[0m
[30;1m261 | [0m[35mare always for the in-development (main branch) of ops, and do not include[0m
[30;1m262 | [0m[35many notes indicating changes or additions across ops versions.[0m
[30;1m263 | [0m[35mWe encourage all charmers to promptly upgrade to the latest version of ops,[0m

[30;1m435 | [0m[35mThere will be overlap between the two files, as many PRs will include changes to[0m
[30;1m436 | [0m[35mcommon infrastructure, or will adjust both `ops` and also the testing API in[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m358 | [0m[35m   both packages, use the ops tag.[0m
[30;1m359 | [0m[35m6. If the last release was for both `ops` and `ops-scenario`, leave the previous[0m
[30;1m360 | [0m[35m   tag choice on `auto`. If the last release was for only one package, change[0m
[30;1m361 | [0m[35m   the previous tag to be the last time the same package(s) were being released.[0m
[30;1m362 | [0m[35m7. Use the "Generate Release Notes" button to get a copy of the changes into the[0m
[30;1m363 | [0m[35m   notes field.[0m
[30;1m364 | [0m[35m8. Format the auto-generated release notes according to the 'Release Documentation'[0m

[30;1m240 | [0m[35m- Avoid passive descriptions. If you expect the reader to do something, give a direct instruction.[0m

[30;1m115 | [0m[35m`.charm` file and replacing the `ops` folder in the virtualenv. This small[0m
[30;1m116 | [0m[35mscript will handle that for you:[0m
[30;1m117 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m```shell-script[0m
[30;1m119 | [0m[35m#!/usr/bin/env bash[0m
